title: AgentArk: Distilling Multi-Agent Intelligence into a Single LLM Agent
what_happened: arXiv:2602.03955v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: While large language model (LLM) multi-agent systems achieve superior reasoning performance through iterative debate, practical deployment is limited by their high computational cost and error propagation. This paper proposes AgentArk, a novel framework to distill multi-agent dynamics into the weights

title: New York Is the Latest State to Consider a Data Center Pause
what_happened: Red and blue states alike have introduced legislation in recent weeks that would halt data center development, citing concerns from climate to high energy prices.

title: The Only Thing Standing Between Humanity and AI Apocalypse Is … Claude?
what_happened: As AI systems grow more powerful, Anthropic’s resident philosopher says the startup is betting Claude itself can learn the wisdom needed to avoid disaster.

title: Moltbook was peak AI theater
what_happened: For a few days this week the hottest new hangout on the internet was a vibe-coded Reddit clone called Moltbook, which billed itself as a social network for bots. As the website’s tagline puts it: “Where AI agents share, discuss, and upvote. Humans welcome to observe.” We observed! Launched on January 28 by Matt Schlicht,…

title: Interfaze: The Future of AI is built on Task-Specific Small Models
what_happened: arXiv:2602.04101v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present Interfaze, a system that treats modern LLM applications as a problem of building and acting over context, not just picking the right monolithic model.
